sentences: Õnnelikud päevad ei tule iseenesest, nende eest on tarvis võidelda.
Need olid õnnelikud hetked meie lapse sünni puhul.
Ta oli väga õnnelik oma uue tööga.
context: The word 'õnnelikud' is the plural form of the adjective 'õnnelik', which means happy, fortunate, or blessed. It describes a state of being filled with happiness and good fortune. In Estonian grammar, adjectives typically have different forms for singular/plural and nominative/genitive cases. The '-d' ending indicates this is in the plural nominative form when modifying masculine nouns, or it could be part of another case depending on context.
